org.microbean.jersey.netty

Class AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microbean.jersey.netty.AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - a type representing the "headers and status" portion of an incoming HTTP or HTTP/2 request
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContainerResponseWriter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Http2ContainerResponseWriter, HttpContainerResponseWriter

    public abstract class AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter<T>
extends Object
implements ContainerResponseWriter
    A partial ContainerResponseWriter implementation that is aware of Netty constructs.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    writeResponseStatusAndHeaders(long, ContainerResponse), commit(), failure(Throwable)

      • AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter

        protected AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter(T requestObject,
                                               ChannelHandlerContext channelHandlerContext,
                                               Supplier<? extends ScheduledExecutorService> scheduledExecutorServiceSupplier)
        Creates a new AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter implementation.
        Parameters:
        requestObject - an object representing the "headers and status" portion of an incoming HTTP or HTTP/2 request; may be null somewhat pathologically
        channelHandlerContext - the ChannelHandlerContext representing the current Netty execution; must not be null
        scheduledExecutorServiceSupplier - a Supplier of ScheduledExecutorService instances that can be used to offload tasks from the Netty event loop; must not be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either channelHandlerContext or scheduledExecutorServiceSupplier is null

        Specified by:

      • commit

        public final void commit()
        Invoked on a non-event-loop thread by Jersey when, as far as Jersey is concerned, all processing has completed successfully.

        This implementation ensures that ChunkedInput.close() is called on the Netty event loop on the ChunkedInput returned by the createChunkedInput(EventExecutor, ByteBuf, long) method, and that a final content message is written immediately afterwards, and that the ChannelHandlerContext is flushed. All of these invocations occur on the event loop.

        Specified by:
        commit in interface ContainerResponseWriter
        See Also:
        ChunkedInput.close(), createChunkedInput(EventExecutor, ByteBuf, long), writeLastContentMessage(), ChannelOutboundInvoker.write(Object), ChannelHandlerContext.flush(), ContainerResponseWriter.commit()

      • failure

        public final void failure(Throwable throwable)
        Invoked on a non-event-loop thread by Jersey when, as far as Jersey is concerned, all processing has completed unsuccessfully.

        This method never returns. It always throws a RuntimeException or an Error of some variety.

        Design Notes

        JAX-RS: Java™ API for RESTful Web Services, section 3.3.4 governs this method, but it is somewhat ambiguous whether this method represents the container itself. All Jersey-supplied ContainerResponseWriter implementations (except their Netty container, which seems to be buggy in this regard) rethrow the supplied Throwable as some kind of RuntimeException from their implementations of this method, so we follow suit.

        Specified by:
        failure in interface ContainerResponseWriter
        Parameters:
        throwable - the Throwable that caused failure; strictly speaking may be null
        Throws:
        ContainerException - thrown whenever this method completes without further problems, or if the supplied Throwable is itself a ContainerException, in order to comply with section 3.3.4 of the JAX-RS 2.1 specification
        RuntimeException - if the supplied Throwable is itself a RuntimeException and this method completes without further problems, or if an error occurs while processing the supplied Throwable in which case the supplied Throwable will be added as a suppressed Throwable
        Error - if the supplied Throwable is itself an Error and this method completes without further problems, or if an error occurs while processing the supplied Throwable in which case the supplied Throwable will be added as a suppressed Throwable
        See Also:
        ContainerResponseWriter.failure(Throwable), JAX-RS: Java™ API for RESTful Web Services, section 3.3.4

      • enableResponseBuffering

        public boolean enableResponseBuffering()
        Returns true when invoked.

        Note that this is a default value. Response buffering can be configured.

        Specified by:
        enableResponseBuffering in interface ContainerResponseWriter
        Returns:
        true when invoked
        See Also:

      • needsOutputStream

        protected abstract boolean needsOutputStream(long contentLength)
        Returns true if the current ContainerResponse being written needs an OutputStream.
        Parameters:
        contentLength - the length of the content in bytes; may be less than 0 if the content length is unknown
        Returns:
        true if an OutputStream should be created and set up; false otherwise
        See Also:
        writeResponseStatusAndHeaders(long, ContainerResponse)

      • writeLastContentMessage

        protected abstract void writeLastContentMessage()
        Called to allow this AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter implementation to write a message that indicates that there is not going to be any further content sent back to the client.
        See Also:
        channelHandlerContext, ChannelOutboundInvoker.write(Object)

      • writeAndFlushStatusAndHeaders

        protected abstract void writeAndFlushStatusAndHeaders(ContainerResponse containerResponse,
                                                      long contentLength)
        Called when this AbstractNettyContainerResponseWriter should write and flush a message containing relevant headers and the HTTP status of the response being processed.
        Parameters:
        containerResponse - the ContainerResponse being processed; must not be null
        contentLength - the length of the content in bytes; may be less than 0 if the content length is unknown

      • createChunkedInput

        protected abstract ChunkedInput<?> createChunkedInput(EventExecutor eventExecutor,
                                                      ByteBuf source,
                                                      long contentLength)
        Called to create a ChunkedInput that will be used as part of setting up an OutputStream for the ContainerResponse being processed.

        Implementations of this method must not return null.

        Implementations of this method will be called only after needsOutputStream(long) has returned true.

        Implementations of this method will always be called on a Thread that is not the Netty event loop.

        Implementations of this method must arrange to read from the supplied ByteBuf. Undefined behavior will result if this is not the case.

        Parameters:
        eventExecutor - an EventExecutor supplied for convenience in case any operations need to be performed on the supplied ByteBuf or on the Netty event loop in general; must not be null
        source - the ByteBuf serving as the source of data; must not be null; must only be read from, not written to
        contentLength - the overall length of the content, in bytes, for which a ChunkedInput is being created; must not be 0; may be less than 0 if the content length is unknown
        Returns:
        a non-null ChunkedInput implementation that will treat the supplied ByteBuf as its source in some manner
        See Also:
        ChunkedInput

      • writeFailureMessage

        protected abstract void writeFailureMessage()
        Called to write a message indicating a general unspecified server failure.

        Implementations of this method are called from the failure(Throwable) method.

        Implementations of this method will always be called on a Thread that is not the Netty event loop.

        See Also:
        failure(Throwable)
